alert.note: Alert for Niagara (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 24 at 6:13PM EDT until July 24 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Buffalo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Niagara County in western New York... * Until 715 PM EDT. * At 613 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Lewiston, or near Niagara Falls, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Niagara Falls, Lockport, Newfane, Lewiston, Youngstown, Fort Niagara State Park, Sanborn, Wilson, Cambria Center, and Olcott. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
